title: Wisdom in Speech and Conduct
shortSummary: Proverbs 15 offers practical wisdom on the power of words, the importance of righteous living, and the fear of the Lord as the foundation of wisdom. This chapter contrasts the behavior and outcomes of the wise and the foolish, encouraging believers to pursue understanding, humility, and godly character. It highlights how speech and attitude affect relationships and spiritual well-being.

keyCharacters.name: The Wise
keyCharacters.description: Those who use knowledge rightly, accept correction, and speak with understanding, embodying godly wisdom.

keyCharacters.name: The Fool
keyCharacters.description: One who despises instruction, pours out foolishness, and rejects reproof, leading to spiritual and practical ruin.

keyCharacters.name: The Righteous
keyCharacters.description: Individuals who live in obedience to God’s commands, whose lives bring blessing and favor from the Lord.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Those who reject God’s ways, whose actions and thoughts are detestable to the Lord and lead to destruction.

definitions.definition: A gentle, calm response that defuses anger and conflict, promoting peace.
Correction or rebuke intended to guide someone back to right behavior or thinking.
A reverent awe and respect for God that leads to obedience and wisdom.
Something detestable or loathsome to God, often referring to sinful actions or attitudes.

outline.heading: The Power of Words and Wisdom
outline.description: This section contrasts gentle and harsh speech, highlighting how wise speech brings knowledge and peace, while foolish words provoke anger and strife.

outline.heading: Righteousness Versus Wickedness
outline.description: The Lord’s attitude toward sacrifices and the ways of the wicked is contrasted with His delight in the prayers and righteousness of the upright.

outline.heading: Responses to Correction and the Heart’s Condition
outline.description: This passage emphasizes the importance of accepting reproof, the joy of a merry heart, and the consequences of folly and slothfulness.

outline.heading: Counsel, Speech, and Life’s Path
outline.description: Wise counsel and timely words are shown to bring joy and establish plans, while the righteous seek to answer thoughtfully and receive God’s favor.

outline.heading: The Fear of the LORD and Humility
outline.description: The chapter concludes by affirming that the fear of the Lord is the foundation of wisdom and that humility precedes honor.

application: Respond with gentleness in conflict to promote peace and avoid escalating anger.
Embrace correction and instruction as opportunities for growth and spiritual maturity.
Cultivate a heart that seeks knowledge and wisdom through the fear of the Lord.
Prioritize godly counsel and thoughtful speech to guide decisions and relationships.

keyVerses.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
keyVerses.significance: This verse teaches the power of gentle speech to defuse conflict and maintain peace.

keyVerses.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights God's rejection of insincere worship and His pleasure in the prayers of the righteous.

keyVerses.text: The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.
keyVerses.significance: This verse summarizes the chapter’s theme that true wisdom begins with reverence for God and is accompanied by humility.
